item.title: RPI Hosts Successful Lets Go Red! Golf Outing
item.description: On Monday, June 3, the Rensselaer athletic department hosted the annual Let’s Go Red! Golf Tournament at Normanside Country Club in Delmar, with the event featuring over 115 golfers that included alumni, key vendors, and RPI campus partners. For the fourth consecutive spring, the team from Hilton Garden Inn-Troy claimed first place in the scramble; Jeff Michaelson, Jeff Miner, Ben Rublee, and Tom Gabriel posted a winning score of 59 to secure the victory by one stroke.
item.author: Community

item.title: Deep-Dive Presentation of Recent Advances in HPC-Quantum Integration to be Held June 14
item.description: From 10AM to 11m on Friday, June 14, the Future of Computing Institute at Rensselaer is pleased to announce a collaborative effort with IBM Quantum for HPC-Quantum integration, and invites you to join this deep-dive presentation of recent advances in HPC-Quantum integration. The goal is to identify subject-matter experts at RPI in HPC and Quantum Computing and their applications.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sanzgiri to be in Residence at EMPAC for “Two Refusals” Feature
item.description: From June 13 - 21, filmmaker Suneil Sanzgiri will be in residence in EMPAC’s Studio 1 to film scenes that will become part of his feature-length film, Two Refusals. Sanzgiri will shoot archival images mapped onto fabric—configured at times like dense landscapes—using various rigging configurations and multiple projectors as a means of considering ways of imaging historical memory.

item.title: CCPD Continues Virtual Summer Series with Tokyo Electron Info Session
item.description: From 6:30PM to 7:30PM on Thursday, June 20, the team at Tokyo Electron U.S. Holdings, Inc. (TEL) will discuss the organization’s career paths and company culture, as well as upcoming opportunities for Arch students seeking an Away experience! Interested students can review the Process Engineer Intern and Process Engineer Co-op opportunities posted in Handshake.

item.title: Registration Now Open for NSF GRFP Bootcamp
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 8:00 AM - First-year graduate students, juniors and seniors are encouraged to register for this virtual program to develop strong applications to the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program, which begins June 24 and provides three years of salary and tuition while students earn their graduate degree. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency is required.
item.author: Students

item.title: RCOS to Sponsor Soundscape Trail Orienteering Field Trip
item.description: Date: Thursday, June 27, 2024 9:30 AM - 3:30 PM - The Renssselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS) will sponsor a field trip to the Shaker Heritage Society site to see how Soundscape — one of RCOS’ active open-source projects — is being used to provide guided tours and athletic events for the visually impaired community. The event is open, but RCOS class members will be given preference; please register by June 13! Lunch will be provided.
item.author: Students

item.title: Faculty Training, “Using Handshake for Undergraduate Research Postings,” to be Held June 25
item.description:
On Tuesday, June 25 from noon to 1:30pm, the CCPD will host an interactive opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. At the end of the training, attendees will know more about Handshake, have an employer profile set up, and be prepared to post their first job. Space is limited to 15 participants; interested faculty should email Nicole Doran to sign up. Lunch will be provided.
